summary: The Coastal Drone Surveillance and Interdiction Assessment Act (H.R. 2775) mandates the Secretary of Homeland Security to assess the effectiveness, risks, and potential of drone deployment to enhance border security and combat maritime and low-altitude drug smuggling along the U.S. coastline. The assessment, due within 180 days of enactment, requires consultation with relevant federal agencies and focuses on major trafficking routes and vulnerable coastal communities. The bill aims to improve border security by utilizing drone technology.
